translations: v．劝告，力劝：用言语或建议鼓励或劝说某人采取某种行动。
· The teacher was exhorting her students to study hard.
老师在劝告她的学生努力学习。

sentences.sentence: Minister rushed about the camp praying and exhorting.
sentences.translation: 牧师在营地到处奔走，一边祷告，一边劝戒。

sentences.sentence: Palin tells her 990, 198 Facebook supporters, exhorting them to turn up at her book signings.
sentences.translation: 佩林告诉990198个Facebook上她的支持者，劝说他们出席她的签名售书会。

sentences.sentence: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some [is]; but exhorting [one another] : and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
sentences.translation: 你们不可停止聚会，好像那些停止惯了的人，倒要彼此劝勉。既知道(原文作看见)那日子临近，就更当如此。
